description: Quasi-Carmichael numbers to base 6: squarefree composites n such that (n,2*3*5) = 1 and prime p|n ==> p-6|n-6.
comments: If multiples of 2, 3 and 5 are not excluded, then terms like 6, 10, 14, 15, 21, 30, 35,... belong to the sequence. - _Giovanni Resta_, May 21 2013
links: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..113 (terms < 5*10^12)
Index entries for sequences related to Carmichael numbers.
mathematica: qcm[n_, d_] := Block[{p, e}, {p, e} = Transpose@FactorInteger@n; Length[p] > 1 && Max[e] == 1 && d < Min[p] && And @@ IntegerQ /@ ((n - d)/(p - d))]; Select[Range[10^6], qcm[#, 6] &] (* _Giovanni Resta_, May 21 2013 *)
author: _David W. Wilson_
